channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Looking to Move into an Apartment?
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Book Your Appointment with COMM+D Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help, so be sure to schedule an appointment with a member of the Center’s trained staff!
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselyrics Spring Auditions to be Held January 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 8:00 PM - 10:30 PM - Enjoy singing gand making music? Audition for the Rensselyrics, RPI’s oldest, self-arranged and produced a cappella group! Sign up in advance, or simply walk-in at the Chapel + Cultural Center; we look forward to seeing you there!
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Slated for January 17
item.description: Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Attendees can expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Michael Century to Perform as Part of “Music @ Noon” Free Concert Series
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 12:00 PM - The Troy Savings Bank Music Hall presents “Music @ Noon,” featuring Michael Century, professor of music and new media in Rensselaer’s School of Humanities, Arts, and Sciences.
item.author: Community

item.title: Annual State Fire Inspections to Begin January 15
item.description: The New York State Office of Fire Prevention and Control (OFPC) conducts annual building inspections of all colleges and universities in New York State. This year, inspections of Rensselaer’s academic and administrative buildings will begin on January 15 and are expected to take approximately six weeks.
item.author: Community

item.title: Volunteers Needed for the VEX Robotics Tournament!
item.description: RPI Robotics will be hosting the area’s largest VEX high school robotics competition on Monday, January 20, and is looking for volunteers for the event! No experience is required, and volunteers receive free food and a T-shirt for helping out; please see the Volunteer Interest form for more information and to sign up, and thanks in advance for your help!
item.author: Community

item.title: Lally HUB Offering Tasty Treats, Informal Break to Welcome Spring Semester
item.description:
Kick off the semester with cocoa, treats, and good vibes in the Lally HUB. Come see the one of a kind miniature Chicago Ferris Wheel made in the machine shop on campus!From 10am to 4pm on January 9 inWhere: Pittsburgh Building, Suite 3200
